text: Thomas Boynton (d.1919) was a British antiquarian from Bridlington. ==Biography== Until 1880 Boynton was a farmer. When drainage works ran through his farmland near Holderness in 1880, he identified and subsequently excavated a series of Prehistoric settlements. These discoveries were initially reported in several newspaper articles between 1883 and 1885. Boynton excavated the Iron Age cemetery site of Danes Graves, alongside William Greenwell and John Robert Mortimer, in 1897–1898. Boynton served as a Vice-President of the Yorkshire Philosophical Society and as Honorary Curator of Antiquities. He was elected as a Fellow of the Society of Antiquaries of Scotland in 1884, and a Fellow of the Society of Antiquaries of London in 1895. ==References== Category:British curators Category:1919 deaths Category:Employees of the Yorkshire Museum Category:Members of the Yorkshire Philosophical Society Category:Fellows of the Society of Antiquaries of London Category:Fellows of the Society of Antiquaries of Scotland
title: Thomas Boynton (antiquarian)
